32.text: Between  1993  to  1994,  Sons  of  Gwalia  Ltd  conducted  gold  exploration  in  the

33.text: Kununalling  area.  The  company  completed  a  structural  interpretation  of the  area  using

34.text: NOAA  imagery.    This  work  outlined  specific  areas  for  follow-up  geochemical  sampling

35.text: and  RAB  drilling.    Four  widely  spaced  traverses,  3  to  8 km  apart,  were  carried  out,

36.text: however no significant gold values were returned.

38.text: In 1996, Aberfoyle Resources Ltd held the area but did no field work.

text:

 Kununalling  area.  The  company  completed  a  structural  interpretation  of the  area  using 
 NOAA  imagery.    This  work  outlined  specific  areas  for  follow-up  geochemical  sampling 
 and  RAB  drilling.    Four  widely  spaced  traverses,  3  to  8 km  apart,  were  carried  out, 
 however no significant gold values were returned.  
 In 1996, Aberfoyle Resources Ltd held the area but did no field work.

28.text: manages  else  where  in  the  state  to  provide  detailed  magnetic  data  in  a  very  cost

34.text: consider the use of detailed ground magnetic traverses, across strike from the exposed

35.text: iron  bearing  units  if  there  are  significant  delays  in  conducting  the  planned  heli-mag

text:
This  exploration  licence covers  about  22 kilometres  strike  length  of  potentially  iron  rich 
 BIF that extends down the centre of the licence area as three separate zones identified 
 from aeromagnetic data and field mapping. 
 Exploration  activity  in  the  past  year  has  involved  data  acquisition  and  review  of 
 geological, geochemical and especially geophysical (aeromagnetic ‘multi-client) surveys. 
 Limited field work to ground truth the interpretations of the remote sensed data used in 
 the review of existing data have been undertaken and will be used to guide further field 
 work in the coming year.   
 Rock  chip  sampling  over  exposed  BIF  sequences  has  been  undertaken  but  sample 
 results have not yet been received. 
 The attached maps (Figures 1-4) show the current interpretation of the data collected in 
 the Kununalling area. 
 FUTURE WORK 
 Iron  Mountain  has  been  conducting  heli-mag  surveys  over  exploration  properties  it 
 manages  else  where  in  the  state  to  provide  detailed  magnetic  data  in  a  very  cost 
 effective  manner.    It  is  the  companies  intention  to  carry  out  such  a  survey  over  the 
 Kununalling  area,  however,  with  the  current  level  of  activity  in  the  exploration  sector 
 client requests for survey work are being organised to ensure the available equipment is 
 used in the most efficient manner.  It is expected that the equipment we wish to use will 
 be available in the Kununalling area in the early part of 2008.  An alternative would be to 
 consider the use of detailed ground magnetic traverses, across strike from the exposed 
 iron  bearing  units  if  there  are  significant  delays  in  conducting  the  planned  heli-mag 
 survey although this may not be as cost effective.
